TI: Sources of the spatial code within the hippocampus.
AB: Neurons in the hippocampus are thought to provide information on an animal's location within its environment. Input to the hippocampus comes via afferents from the entorhinal cortex, which are separated into several major pathways serving different hippocampal regions. Recent studies show the significance of individual afferent pathways in location perception, enhancing our understanding of hippocampal function.
AD: Center for Memory and Brain, Department of Psychology and Program in Neuroscience Boston University, 2 Cummington Street, Boston, MA 02215 USA.
